intro: Euploca pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered euploca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Euploca pauciflora has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster. It is a relatively rare species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
